The game cannot be recommended in it's current state. The balancing is nonexistent and for a "good reason" tho.

If you wanna play killer then good luck with the matchmaking, the game has been losing players ever since mikaela was added alongside of the MMR system, a small playerbase that is already split around regions will never have a healthy matchmaking unless you are ready to eat 15minutes Q times in exchange for a balanced match.

For survivors it is pretty much that way, long ass Q's because there are not enough killers around, and understandably so, because playing killer is garbage in this absolutely survivor sided game.

The game cannot be more balanced for killers, because if the busted perks gets touched enough by BHVR, that will upset the vast majority of the playerbase, because there are way too many survivor players. So that's a problem they have to deal with and killers are just expected to be way above the curve of the experienced survivors to have an even match.

A single survivor can carry an entire match with the busted perks and a flashlight, but this only happens if the killer is inexperienced and doesn't know any better than never chase this player and bait the flashlight. Now imagine having two of these, or three, because remember, there are 4 survivors in a match. That's how the games will go after you pass certain threshold in their "MMR system" yours games will be all sweaty.

Recently they did address the issues of MMR and did some tweaks to make the matches fair. But honestly? I have experienced worse matches overall. At the start around the 10~ hours of gameplay I'd find myself having 2 even matches and then a very sweat match with 4 escapes, then the loop will repeat. Since the changes were added it's been 3 absolutely out of my level matches followed by a match with total new players, and that cycle will repeat. Not a single match felt fair. So for me the only change they made was hide the ranks so you could not tell if the matchmaking fucked you in the ass because the red rank survivor was in the Q for 7 minutes and was thrown against the first killer they found in the region or you faced a very talented/good player in your level.

nice (69 hrs)

I manage to make it to Gold 1 aka rank 5 as a wraith main. ( i prefer to use old ranking system thanks to my friend who taught me) killer when i only have 70 hrs in game. Never played or watched any videos on this game before i bought it. Don't let the toxicity from survivor mains get you down is a newbie can make it to rank 5 in under 100 total hrs of game play you can make it better with time as well. (70 hrs)

Edit: 171.3 hours later and im finally rank 1 killer

Overall I give this game a good rating (mostly because of how the game and community were when I first started playing), now that being said here are (in my opinion) the negative aspects of the game:

*Parts of the community: This isn't everyone, but there are some TOXIC people that play this game. With that being said there are also some super chill people that play this game and when you find them add them and "hold on" to them so that you can actually have a decent experience playing this game.

*Marketing/Multiplayer: DBD is marketed as a "casual" game to play with friends. If you are new and playing solo queue matches I almost guarantee you will be DONE with this game after a few matches. Unless you have friends to play with be prepared to be left on hook, left behind, etc.

*"Kills = skill" AKA MMR: Currently the way the game works as a survivor: it doesn't matter what you do, how you play, etc. unless you ESCAPE. Soooo you might as well run spine chill, urban evasion, and other stealth perks and just hide in a corner until the rest of your team does all the work for you so you can get out.

*Events: The last few events have been kind of uhhhh ehhhhhh. You get some cosmetics here and there, but they are ALWAYS for the same characters (Dwight, Claudette, David, and a couple others). I generally main Elodie and she has like ONE outfit that is actually stylish which is such a RIP. Mostly they just throw extra bloodpoints your way which is cool, but like also sort of who cares? You can get bloodpoints so easily by running certain perks, using offerings, etc. so getting them as an event perk is pretty much a joke.

With all that being said, clearly I still play this game after 1K + hours and all the stuff I mentioned before so clearly something in my brain keeps telling me to go back. Maybe I am just a masochist and that is why, but yeah overall I would recommend this game. Just be aware of the aforementioned before buying this game.

This game has a lot to offer. Plenty of characters, perks, and weird mechanics to learn your way around. I enjoy the grind. Problem is a lot of people get enraged by this game, and I can see why. As survivor you're usually at the mercy of your team, so it really sucks when they throw. As killer you gotta be ready to be bullied. A lot of the maps are ridiculously survivor sided, and some survivor perks are so OP I'm not quite sure why they're in the game. I think the fun that can be had is rewarding enough tho.
Toxic game but can't stop playing it :D

Still a good a but run into a lot of greiffers

The game itself is alright. Ive got thousands of hours between steam,live,xbox and mobile. A while back though my account got hacked,and the hacker used cheats. Well recently that caught up to me (after changing my passwords and what not.),and i have been banned. When i tried to appeal the ban,INCLUDING PROVIDING THE EVIDENCE I HAVE OF THE HACK,the response was "Your appeal was denied. Its youre account youre responsible for the security and what happens to it." Excuse the fuck out of me? So if BHVR gets hacked,or their discord,or whatever.....the response we get as consumers is " Sorry about the inconvenience,we are working to fix it" (Even if account information gets stolen from their end)....But as a consumer who PAID these pricks (for a buggy mess of a game,which just keeps getting worse)(although i do enjoy playing it just for giggles) if my information gets stolen its tough shit? What a great way to run a company. Be leery,as i now have a VAC ban tainting my profile. (after roughly 12 years of having a steam profile with ZERO issues btw.)
Terrorize people with Spirit Fury x Enduring or by doing gens in under 30 seconds. Either way 10/10 experience.

Do you want a game that makes you tilt harder than a redneck seeing a rainbow flag? If you love fleeting moments of self-satisfaction, feelings of never-ending inferiority, all mixed with thousands of dollars of micro-transactions, then look no further! Dead By Daylight is the game for you! Lose all your friends, destroy romantic relationships, isolate yourself from friends and family and play this decade-old game!
if you dont take it seriously its the funnest shit ive played in awhile. Legion chase music is the only reason i main them

Game has several major issues which go unfixed for years and years. Would not recommend if you have a competitive nature as there are many things terribly balanced and unfair. Way more fun for casual players who care less about doing well.

This game is good fun. I only play killer because I hate the feeling of being chased. While it can get frustrating at times, it is incredibly satisfying when your plans pay off. Requires a lot of strategy and playing mind games. Games are short so its nice to get a few rounds in when I have some down time.

Good but it'd be nice if instead of allowing you to open the escape as the killer you could close it and make the survivors reopen it but it doesn't take as long

they somehow make the game worse every update, killers can grab survives so easily like getting out of a locker. 1/2 the new killers are op. and now they hide ranks since their ranking system was so bad :/

I really can't recommend this game, it's just not fun. I came from Xbox to PC and it's still a very unenjoyable time. Playing as killer sucks and a lot of the times (at least from what I've seen) the survivors are pretty toxic, and you'll probably be up against 4 people SWFs a lot, which makes it feel kind of unfair, especially to newer killers who are just learning. I've definitely gotten my fair share of "uninstall the game" "ur bad xd", and a couple "KYS" from post-game messages. I think the game itself is fine, I do like the game as a game, but the community kills the entire experience with how utterly childish it is.

Do you enjoy cat and mouse? Do you love SBMM? Do you love having killers that were once cool, only to be nerfed to death and be horrible because of cry baby meta survivors? Do you love....the idea....of strong immortal killers being weak and playing on survivors time? Then this game if for you! Now while DBD isnt terrible, it sure isnt as good or as fun. As when the game first came out. So as of right now this game is only fun, IF you play META and you know what you are doing. Regardless the game has 2 sides you can pick in this spooky pvp. One of them is being a survivor, as a survivor your main goal is to turn on 5 generators and escape by using any means necessary whether it be hiding, using Decisive Strike, Dead Harding, Boon Totems, Adrenaline, Borrowed Time, but anything to avoid being "hooked" or dying. Now the other side you can play as is Killer. Now your main objective as killer is.....well to kill. No matter by what tactic you use, whether it be by camping, tunneling, or using Nurse and Spirit only. Your only job is to kill. Of course, each killer has a special ability or power that they can use to make chases easier, but at the end of the day you have to kill by moris or hooking. But remember...you are a killer, and as a killer you don't care about the rules you just want to kill heheheh. Although be prepared, because as a killer you must always endure toxic entitled survivors in chat after the matches, even if you do play fair Muwhahah. But I digress, in the end while the games not as fun as it used to be. You should still give it a shot especially if you love competitive PVP and if you love playing with friends, but I will say its not a "must-get" game. 

Good 

- Legendary Killers Like Michael Myers and Freddy Krueger (DLC)
- Funny Salty Survivor Moment and Rage
- Good Maps
- Intense Matches escaping/chases
- Lots of Cool Killers
- Nice Idea
- Best Fun to have with friends

Bad

- SBMM
- Cant play with Every Killer because of SBMM and META
- META based
- Toxic Community (Survivor Mostly)
- Survivor Sided

Game Overall: 6/10
